website_summaries.verdict: Don't let reported quirks stop you from considering this plant cover if you need an effective way to cover plants and protect them from most weather and pest threats.
pros: Decent price for a large cover
Fairly lightweight and easy to use
Protects against weather conditions, including hail
Works well for covering raised gardens
cons: May not protect against major freezes
Polypropylene material is prone to tears

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy yet light
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my raised bed pvc pipe frame. Really impressed with the durability while being light and airy. I put it up to protect seedlings, open and close every day. It’s holding up remarkably well.
customer_reviews.author: wwhite

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: I am now a believer in this stuff! We always had a hard time growing kale, as the bugs would get at it and eat the leaves. After getting plastic tubing from Menards that would bend, I put plastic PVC sections into the ground, inserted the ends of the tubing into in, and bent it into a U-shapped form over the plants. I then put this stuff over it and fastened it to the tubing, and it worked GREAT. Water and sunshine went through for good growth, but the bugs, butterflies and caterpillars couldn't get it, so the kale grew perfectly into December in Indiana. FANTASTIC. Will do this every year from now on, and with other crops!!
customer_reviews.author: PURCH-PRO

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my raised beds
customer_reviews.text: Great product- protects plants from harsh weather and pests. I use bricks to hold the edges down instead of stakes because I like to reuse the sheets when I can. It's hard to reuse them with holes along the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda L. Arthur

customer_reviews.title: High quality fabric that does not rip easily
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for around 3 months now. I am still growing salad greens in WNC under a simple wire cover with their 0.95oz cover in December. They were covered in snow for 3 days recently and only suffered minor damage. Extremely happy with their fabric and I plan on building a more extensive mini “hoop house” for salad greens in the spring. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this fabric to anyone for gardening or extending a season for a crop.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Wow - Really Works
customer_reviews.text: I am handicapped and last year when it froze, I could not walk well so all my plants froze. I bought this to help cover them and something I could to do. It is long and was able to cut and use in two places. It really protected my geraniums and they are still blooming. Thin, lightweight, and does not look make my yard look junky.
customer_reviews.author: EPTXGAL

customer_reviews.title: Saved my cactus
customer_reviews.text: I live in Austin Texas and it only freezes a few nights a year, but when it does it can kill my citrus trees and some of my other more sensitive plants. I have a little cactus garden that I need to keep from freezing, and this product made all the difference in the world!
customer_reviews.author: Форест лес

customer_reviews.title: Quality of this product is poor. The material was not as described.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the “floating row cover” previously and was very satisfied. But this time when the cover was delivered the thickness was to thin. I had to fold the cover 3 folds thick in order to cover my plants against the frost. I cannot return it because I cut it I needed to cover my plants now to protect them. I did notice on the package of this order the thickness is (0.55 oz.). The previous order package aside the thickness was (0.9 oz). That difference made this product not as effective for the use it was made for. So I am not satisfied or happy to pay a higher price for poor quality...
customer_reviews.author: MARY J.

customer_reviews.title: Your Garden Will Love this cozy shelter.
customer_reviews.text: Great Product. It gets the job done. The dimensions will more than cover the average width garden row. The fabric is light and airy and allows in just enough sunlight to keep your garden thriving while protecting tinder plants from frost. I was surprised to discover that my Spinach and Kale was ready to harvest when I pulled back the cover after two weeks of sub-freezing temperatures.

customer_reviews.title: Use with caution
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of row cover. However this is my first purchase from this manufacturer. The vendor ship my package quickly and it arrived in great condition. When I compare this row cover to my previous package, I have noted that it is not as tear resistant as the other 0.55oz material. In fact, it sometimes rips. It works well enough otherwise, but I will look for a different manufacturer next time.
customer_reviews.author: TheTroller

customer_reviews.title: Working Well to Extend Growing Season
customer_reviews.text: It is working well over the veggies in my western WA raised, on-deck cedar beds. Harvested the last jalapeno & chili peppers yesterday after a freeze - parsley, cilantro, chard, green onions are doing well. Only problem was a 4" tear in the fabric (from ?) but have that closed with a small binder clip. I also lay clear plastic over these beds for extra protection from the cold & damp.
customer_reviews.author: GardenLover

customer_reviews.title: Split & Tore While Removing from Package
customer_reviews.text: While this product did protect my creeping fig growing on the chimney from the cold, it split and tore along the folded seam as I gently removed it from the package leaving me with a smaller amount of fabric to work with. Was the product defective? I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: kayu

customer_reviews.title: Good protection
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a hoop house but I lay the cover directly on top of the raised beds to keep moisture in and to keep animals from digging after I sow seeds. It also raises the temperature to help germination. This fabric is so big I cut it into two pieces for my raised beds. Good material I'm sure it will last many seasons.
customer_reviews.author: CautiousShopper

customer_reviews.title: Early Veggie Bed
customer_reviews.text: Fabric was delivered in a timely manner and was as described. The material is thin but appears to be up for the task. Constructed two 6 foot long tube shelters and installed over mixed early veggies. Will update as garden grows.
customer_reviews.author: MJArchitect

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit!
customer_reviews.text: The 10x15 row cover will allow me to have adequate fabric to create a green house effect over my tropical scallions. The fabric will keep out the onion maggot flies in the spring and allow me to get perfect scallions for my soups and stews in the summer. I will send pictures and an update next spring.
customer_reviews.author: JAHMAKER

customer_reviews.title: Not for fruit trees.
customer_reviews.text: I do not think that putting this on a small fruit tree is a good idea. I know a little about spun floating covers and know that they do tear. My boyfriend, however, thought otherwise. It did eventually tear in places and part of branches poked free. It did deter birds from seeing the fruit on the tree but not the ones that fell on the ground. I would have gone for either bird netting floating cover combo or a fabric that has netting combined in the fabric.
customer_reviews.author: kelika14

customer_reviews.title: doesnt protect
customer_reviews.text: I lost my tomatoes, squash and my lettuces are wilted. Save yourself the time and trouble and use a heavy duty tarp. THis did not protect at all.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ok this isn’t fair but our rolls were 8 ft shorted!
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth dunaway

customer_reviews.title: nice light weight fabric
customer_reviews.text: Used this to cover a raised garden bed of kale. Good sun protection and keeps the moths from laying their eggs on the plants. The only thing that concerned me was rain being able to get through the fabric. I think a lot of it would run off so I do uncover my kale if rain is coming. I think I will be using some next spring at frost time too. It's good protection while being light weight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Donna J

customer_reviews.title: No protection from the cold
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is so incredibly thin it did not provide protection from the cold at all!! Our plants all died under it and we even doubled it!! It is no good as frost protection.
customer_reviews.author: Aryn Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Like it, but there are holes in it.  Not alot but enought to make me comment
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this several times and I like it a lot, but I lowered the score because I am finding more and more holes in it right out of the box. Bad QA going on lately. I guess the price accounts for it. Probably seconds. Dodson Farm.
customer_reviews.author: Dodson Farm

customer_reviews.title: Good protection from frost.
customer_reviews.text: New to AZ and was not aware of frost. Needed something to protect delicate plants. This material did the job. It's a long piece but I cut it up in pieces to cover the plants I needed. Only problem is that it blows away easily so I had to weigh it down. Also allows sunshine to penetrate during the day so the cover does not have to be removed from plants.
customer_reviews.author: JOAM228

customer_reviews.title: It's been 2 weeks. It's tearing on the pvc ...
customer_reviews.text: It's been 2 weeks. It's tearing on the pvc hoops. Maybe they should include some patch tape. I ordered a 12ft x 100 last time and it was stronger. I have clamps and rocks anchoring it down on hoops. I do believe this batch is slightly thinner compared to the 12x100 at first sight. I'm giving it 3 stars even with the rips because it's very affordable. I would give it 4 stars if they included the patch tape.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Yao

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy fabric for plant protection
customer_reviews.text: At the recommendation of a friend I used my Agfabric to protect my beans and peppers from rabbits in my back yard. I created a fabric fence and it worked perfectly! The fabric is sturdy but seems to let moisture and sunlight through. After using it this year, I plan to use it in the spring as early weather protection for delicate vegetables and rabbit deterrent again.
customer_reviews.author: katefur

customer_reviews.title: Good row cover
customer_reviews.text: Used for making covers for our potted plants to keep out aphids and other little pests. We cut the row cover into pieces to cover a frame we made from pvc pipe that fits over our planter and to cover a round cloche that goes over our potted herbs. We have been happy with the fabric we used before and this fabric seems to be a little better quality. Hopefully it will hold up for more than 1 year like our old fabric did. It also keeps the plants a little cooler when the sun is really hot.
customer_reviews.author: D. Henley

customer_reviews.title: Nice protection
customer_reviews.text: This fabric is lightweight yet does help with holding the heat in. I built a hoop house this year as an experiment with summer squash to see if I can keep the bugs away that always kill my squash. I will have to pollinate the squash myself, but if it means having squash all season long, it will be worth it. This fabric will keep those pesky bugs away. I will update this review later to see how the fabric held up.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to- no bugs!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cover. This is the second time I’ve bought it. I use it all season on my carrots and lettuces. It helps keep the bugs out and the plants grow great! I just bought some wire from tractor supply and made hoops with it. And bricks to hold down the cover. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Singler

customer_reviews.title: Agfabric floating row cover
customer_reviews.text: Great product< exactly what I needed. I read a lot about row covers, what they can do and the differences. I gave this 4 stars because the one i received had a tear down the middle making a large part useless. BUT, I contacted the Company who immediately authorized a free return and full credit. I will order from them again. i believe this was a one time thing and i appreciate the integrity shown. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Inferior product
customer_reviews.text: I have used row covers for years and reuse them over and over! This row cover is very weak and has ripped in several spots since it was placed over my plants only 2 weeks ago. I'm extremely disappointed in this product and would like a refund!
customer_reviews.author: ej

customer_reviews.title: Well made ,good product
customer_reviews.text: It's a good item. I just didn't realize it came all folded up , and its difficult for me to get it all out and organized, because I'm disabled, it's real difficult to use. I was expecting a roll. A roll is alot easier to use. But it's well made product
customer_reviews.author: Starman

customer_reviews.title: good product, good seller
customer_reviews.text: very light weight. I was concerned about creating a lot of garbage, but this whole 100 by 10 foot roll weigh nothing and would likely melt down to less plastic than is in a water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Robel Parra

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've only used a short while. Installed in Zone 7 in late August to reduce chances of veggies turning due to extreme heat / sun exposure, insects, birds. So far so good, however, I have seen a few bees buzzing about as well as a butterfly which means there are likely some bad bugs in there too even though I haven't seen any signs of them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works.  Worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: We use this over sensitive succulents and other perennials when frost is predicted here in S. Texas. So far it’s protected us great. Have many of them!
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: completely waterproof
customer_reviews.text: i read the reviews, one of them claimed that you can water through the fabric but NOT SO! the water rolled off even if i sprayed right onto the fabric. did not work for me as i needed to lift up the cover to water my plants. a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: My young garden plants love this row cover
customer_reviews.text: My young garden plants love this row cover! I've tested the same vegetable with and without the cover and the covered ones are healthier looking and less insect bitten than the others. I support the cloth with small wooden dowel rods stuck 3-4 inches in the soil and fastened with small binder clips. Not expensive. This is a very useful product.
customer_reviews.author: DannyBoy69

customer_reviews.title: Is What It Is
customer_reviews.text: Row covers are pretty standard across the board. This was the cheaper than I could find through catalogs. Forget trying to find it locally.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Howard Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle and cut to size
customer_reviews.text: I needed a floating row cover to protect spinach and lettuce seedlings from rabbits. This cover is light weight, easy to handle, and has good light transmission. I cut it into 5 foot by 6 foot sections for my 4x4 raised beds. This cover likely provides little frost protection, but that wasn't the objective for me. At this price, I only need it to last one season.
customer_reviews.author: Electroniker

customer_reviews.title: Buy this not Agribon
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality, much better than agribon. The ends are finished and it's a great quality. I bought the equivalent product from Agribon and this one is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Vawser

customer_reviews.title: I needed 10 x 15 foot cover but the light weight made it easy to handle and secure
customer_reviews.text: I was harvesting tomatoes and basil until mid-October...in the high desert. My neighbors pulled their plants up a month ago! I just canned the last of my (stewed, whole and roasted sauce) tomatoes and chow-chow today. I needed 10 x 15 foot cover but the light weight made it easy to handle and secure. And it's still in perfect condition so I can use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: ... this cover material to protect my tomatoes from the horrible swarm of STINK BUGS that invade my garden
customer_reviews.text: I need this cover material to protect my tomatoes from the horrible swarm of STINK BUGS that invade my garden. They swarm me and ruin my tomatoes! I'll put it over my tomato cages as soon as I plant them, & hope I can keep the bugs away. I've tied screen wife and netting, but they actually go under the product to get to the fruit! I'm determined to have fresh tomatoes this spring & hopefully some canned ones too!
customer_reviews.author: reckonnot

customer_reviews.title: 14 degrees and still alive
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great so far. I am growing milkweed and I started the seeds to early. They are outside with a heating mat under them and this row cover over them. It has been as low as 14 degrees and everything looks great. What's nice is I don't have to cover and uncover them because the fabric seem to let light through.
customer_reviews.author: C. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Works like a frost cloth should
customer_reviews.text: Like all large frost cloths, it's kinda hard to spread out by yourself. I cut mine in half so that it wouldn't be so unweildy. But it worked as it should and kept my plants alive for 2 nights that it dropped below freezing.
customer_reviews.author: Wheeler985

customer_reviews.title: Great way to extend your season.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to provide row cover to cold-hardy plants in our zone 6a area. Was able to grow peas, greens, and root veggies with minimal to no cold-damage ALL winter long (even with some single digit nights). Actually replanted some in a warm spell in January. Very happy. Should get at least one more season out of these as a got a small hole or two here and there (likely more from my pea supports).
customer_reviews.author: cliffchic

customer_reviews.title: Shade cloth
customer_reviews.text: This product has saved our garden from the sun..it also got for pests..you can get the stakes which I love.. to hold the covers down..I will continue to buy this product as my garden space grows.
customer_reviews.author: lr

customer_reviews.title: Very Light Row Cover
customer_reviews.text: Great product and reasonably priced. This material is a little lighter than i wanted. Couldnt tell from the description. I recommend the heavier product. It will last longer and not so likely to get snagged. Great for starters out door, even in freeze temps still went from grow light to under cover without harding off.
customer_reviews.author: Bruckley

customer_reviews.title: does not protect
customer_reviews.text: I lost my tomatoes and my squash and my lettuces are brown on the tips. I live in Louisiana. Our weather got down to 28 the other morning. There was no frost.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the bugs out. Let’s the rain in.  Creates shade for cool weather crops.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great! I am using it to cover my broccoli and cauliflower in raised beds. Usually I lose it all to bugs eating the leaves. This year I’m getting great heads of broccoli and cauliflower. It also gives these cool weather crops the shade they need while letting the rain go through. I only wish I had tried this years ago!
customer_reviews.author: L. Gingerich

customer_reviews.title: While it is not as water-allowing as I would like, it is better than having cabbage moths all ...
customer_reviews.text: While it is not as water-allowing as I would like, it is better than having cabbage moths all over the cabbages.
customer_reviews.author: Moomin&Mutti

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: Does the job at a good price. Keeping my strawberries from being decimated by birds. Good size for the planter box I have. Cuts easily with plain old household shears. I will be able to use this package for years and there is a generous amount of yardage.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Lover

customer_reviews.title: Super thin
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love their product but.. this one is suuuuper thin, originally thought it was too short but when I started to cut you could see it was double how thin it was and I just pray it works because I have so much invested in my garden. The picture is sure deceiving cause you can see right through it.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Ripped with wind storm
customer_reviews.text: I had this first over my greenhouse (attached to trampoline frame with PVC snaps) and it ripped in a few days. I then used it to wrap my tomatoes and peppers and again it ripped quickly. I live in South Texas so we don't get huge wind gusts or snow storms.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea W.

customer_reviews.title: Used all winter and the only time we couldn't harvest ...
customer_reviews.text: Used all winter and the only time we couldn't harvest was when the snow was too high! Spring we were eating before any of the other members of our community garden
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Arrived faster than expected! Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Came just in time for our first frost - thank you for that speedy delivery!! :) :) Works great!
customer_reviews.author: DianaLu

customer_reviews.title: rips very easy, ripped while stretching out to put on plants
customer_reviews.text: its very light weight but will tear very easy, i was laying over my pvc pipe in raised beds and was torn before i was finished covering the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I’m currently using this cover. It seems to do what it’s supposed to. However buy spikes to keep it in place as it is very light weight and flys when the wind blows.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Herring

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the early frost dates. But I use it for shading my veggies and the cabbage moth stays out...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Turned spindly plants into much stronger, healthy plants.
customer_reviews.text: We were very pleased with the floating row cover. We covered up our peppers and tomatoes for several weeks and found they grew and strengthened a lot. Will plan on using this again next spring when we put our plants out. Will also consider using it this fall if we still have produce that may be affected by overnight frost. Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Carol E Scheuermann

customer_reviews.title: Saved my zucchini plant!
customer_reviews.text: First photo is days after planting - two entire stems were eaten by pests. Second photo is four weeks later after being under the row cover. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: edina

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Used as a row cover for winter veggies. Cat love’s getting in no matter how I block her. She just rips another place and gets in. Not sure ya’ll can do anything about that. Otherwise good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product to try to start my seedlings earlier in the spring. I have ended up keeping it over my Basil, lettuce, Kale, arugula, and cilantro all summer. Allows water in, but the diffuse sunlight keeps those things that typically bolt quickly in check and growing strong and steady! It also keeps the bugs out if you tuck the ends as well. I am glad I bought the 100 foot roll to be able to use it for years to come. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: patsfan

customer_reviews.title: Too light weight for my purposes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fabric to lay directly over germinating seeds. They grow right through, which defeats the idea once I take the fabric off. Rips the seedlings out. I personally don't think it's that sturdy either. Won't be buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthie

customer_reviews.title: Bad ending
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for frost protection. I was sorely disappointed at the thinness of this material. It is nothing more than a shade cloth. There is no frost protection to this fabric whatsoever. Had to triple the material to get it even close enough to protecting my annuals.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to drape over plants.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for temperatures above freezing. I was able to keep my outside plants on the porch a little longer before wintering indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bug control
customer_reviews.text: I received this on time and intact. I haven't put up the tunnels yet as I just got them a few days ago. I intend to use these as a cover to protect against Potato beetles.
customer_reviews.author: Kayt

customer_reviews.title: great protection
customer_reviews.text: used for brussel sprouts, kale and red cabbage for my spring garden. Had had a terrible struggle with cabbage worms the last few years - this solved the problem. also worked well with seed germination keeping the soil warmer.
customer_reviews.author: NoNo

customer_reviews.title: Prevents freeze damage
customer_reviews.text: I live in AZ in the valley where we rarely have freezing temperatures. We had a hard freeze for several days I would had lost a lot of my plants if not for the frost protection cover.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Perry

customer_reviews.title: Product was not as described. 2ft too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: How is it possible to miss a 5 ft measurement by 2 feet 6 inches? Ridiculous waste of my time. will never or agfabric product or related from Amazon or Amazon seller again. extremely dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy protection from weather and weeds
customer_reviews.text: I have raised beds and have garden hoops on top and then this material. I had very few weeds and the hail did not kill my garden. I love this material. It is easy to cut and lasts the summer season.
customer_reviews.author: christina helsel

customer_reviews.title: Misrepresentation of product length
customer_reviews.text: Product description and that the cover is 25 foot long, the label on the package says the same. When I unpacked it I found that it was maybe 1/2 that long. Gross misrepresentation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too delicate
customer_reviews.text: Rips easily. Not impressed. The wind tore it up within one week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and it works.
customer_reviews.text: I apreaciated the quality and light weight properties of this item. The light gets through as advertized and can be used for shade cloth and for light frost covereing.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryne A. Eblen

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good fabric. Seems to be holding up well for several weeks with some rain and wind.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck S

customer_reviews.title: Good for expected hard freeze.
customer_reviews.text: I live in California so we're not used to getting hard freezes. We're expecting one this Sunday night so I ordered this to cover my flower beds. Nice weight but easy to cut to size. I don't know if it would work in snow.
customer_reviews.author: Ptown JHO

customer_reviews.title: Tears easily.
customer_reviews.text: It's OK but somewhat fragile. First winter using and it already has holes after only a few months. Does not like the wind!
customer_reviews.author: hhij

customer_reviews.title: This was the super lightweight fabric I was looking for and couldn't find ...
customer_reviews.text: This was the super lightweight fabric I was looking for and couldn't find on local garden stores. Really works to increase temps and keep the deer out of the lettuce. It would help deter predatory bunnies too, if the edges were tacked down more securely. Big difference in growth between the bed with fabric and the one without. Now both have fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Lillianne Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: Nice material
customer_reviews.text: Nice material, I don’t have bricks so had to use pins to keep from wind blowing it away.
customer_reviews.author: quilter101

customer_reviews.title: Good fabric. Seems more see through than the ones ...
customer_reviews.text: Good fabric. Seems more see through than the ones I bought in the past. The package I got had the fabric all bunched up and wrinkled instead of being nicely folded.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene S

customer_reviews.title: Frost blanket
customer_reviews.text: First year using it. Was lighter weight than I expected,but I guess it has to be.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Keeps moths off our broccoli!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to drape over our cabbage and broccoli bed to keep the cabbage moths at bay. It's done a fairly good job at that (we find the odd moth flying around now and then, but so far, haven't found worms. It does increase the temperature in the bed somewhat, which may be the cause of our broccoli bolting earlier than usual. However, all in all, it's been a usable product.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a large amount of row cover fabric
customer_reviews.text: Great deal on a large amount of row cover fabric. This stuff seems stronger than the previous cheaper stuff I've used since it's already lasted through one season with no holes or tears.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I had expected the fabric to be heavier, my own mistake I guess. Rips easily in the wind. Probably works well for a ground cover...but not to cover a small hoop house.
customer_reviews.author: twohorses

customer_reviews.title: ... freezing dips right now and this cover is working great! I am also using it as a wind ...
customer_reviews.text: We have some freezing dips right now and this cover is working great! I am also using it as a wind shield as it is very windy where we live. So far so good with this cover!
customer_reviews.author: ILoveBooks

customer_reviews.title: wouldn't call it heavy
customer_reviews.text: It is not the plastic kind, It is some fabric. Works fine, very light. Water will go through it, but you can't really water through it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Good Product but Delicate
customer_reviews.text: This cover works great and is just the right side. It tears easily though, so you have to be very careful with how you anchor it to the ground
customer_reviews.author: Constance Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great cover for Frost and not expensive
customer_reviews.text: Helps the plants from frosting over. Got this for my mom's garden in Chicago. No complaints from her yet.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Hunawill

customer_reviews.title: admits sunlight.
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job of protecting my tomatoes from critters and insects.
customer_reviews.author: H.W. KOLLMER

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Covered my cabbage this year and was suprised at how durable it was
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend the product
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for my vegetable garden. Under this protection, my leafy greens are still doing well now in zone 6.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Did what it said it would do. I used it to cover my plants from the freezing weather.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Great for shade and bug cloth
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully this brand will be just as good as others I have used-working well so far
customer_reviews.author: Linda Hawn

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: With all the bad weather we are having I have been using the row cover every night to protect my plants. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Doris L. Ainsworth

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for shading delicate plants during the mid-day, direct sun. Exactly what I was looking for. Can't find it in stores.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in a timely manner, and was exactly as advertised. Has a nice weight and is working very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amy buntjer

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised
customer_reviews.text: Works to protect my plants from light frost. Easy to apply and remove.
customer_reviews.author: sharon barnes

customer_reviews.title: Great material and measurements were correct
customer_reviews.text: Great material and measurements were correct! Exactly what I needed and was looking for. The material is reusable and does not get destroyed in the sun/ rain/ or snow.
customer_reviews.author: Tsmsss

customer_reviews.title: Makes possible a long growing season
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! I'm still able to grow lettuces and herbs even mid December!
customer_reviews.author: Deni Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great row, worked great to keep starts warm in spring
customer_reviews.author: Carina

customer_reviews.title: Love the width and strength of this item
customer_reviews.text: Love this item strong and the width is great. Used it to cover my Squash plants to keep squash bugs from getting in while plants were small and growing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H. Farris

customer_reviews.title: Good tow cover!
customer_reviews.text: Light weight yet strong, this material protected my veggies from frost Quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Received on time. Packed well. Slightly thinner than expected. Don't believe it will last more than one season.
customer_reviews.author: Little Homesteader

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Spring and Winter Garden.
customer_reviews.text: Not as durable as I’d like. Falls apart after two seasons. But I still use this type of products for my garden.
customer_reviews.author: AzBulldog

product_meta.title: Agfabric Heavy Floating Row Cover and Plant Blanket, 0.9oz Fabric of 6x25ft for Frost Protection and Terrible Weather Resistant
feature_bullets: Super Heavy-Weight FRCs (1.5-2.0 oz./sq. yard): Are usually used to extend the growing season in spring and fall, allow 30%-50% light transmission, recommend of freeze protection and season extension, resist harsh weather such as wind, snow, hail...
UV PROTECTION High quality spun polypropylene fabric is UV stabilized and reusable, and allows air and moisture to reach your plants
EASY INSTALLATION Measured size as described, easy to cover it on the plant top personally
MULTI-APPLICATION Protect your vegetable such as tomato, pepper, pumpkin, strawberry rows, fruit trees, citrus and shrub, flowers as well as newly-sown grass
WEATHER PROTECTION Protect plants from snow, hail, frost in the winter and insects,birds during the growing season
